title: Why does urgot have no weaknesses at all?
body: low mana costs, low cooldowns, mobile, endless duration of super fast attacks, high burst, tanky, cc, and exectute? What the fuck?

replies.body:
His cooldowns aren't short and his durations aren't infinite in the early game. When his knees go on cooldown in the laning phase, you have a long window to attack him from that angle. 

His range is very short. His dash is tiny, and also on a long cooldown. Every champion has flash, you can't count that as his mobility alone. 

His big damage comes from his combo of flip into W, then shotgun you as you try to get back to your side of the lane. If you dodge the flip, his damage is much lower. 

Urgot is a snowballing juggernaut, who needs to get kills in order to thrive. Deny him those kills and kite him in teamfights, and he's virtually useless. 

Buy armor.

You asked for Urgot's weakness, it's his low range, low mobility, and weak early game. You don't beat him once he's fed, you lost the game by losing lane to Urgot.

I don't like playing against Urgot in general but he's not mobile. The only insane thing that I can't wrap my head around is his W becomes a toggle ability that costs no mana and can even target structures... Like why is the cost of that ability decreasing over time?

Because his W is doing literally _nothing_ on it's own.

It is just a tool to efficiently proc his passive, but the ability itself does not provide much since they moved the shield away from it.

it is infinite and does 36 percent of ad to champions and structures endlessly his tankiness means he can walk up to a turret with no minions and just kill it because for some unknown reason turret damage is capped.

It does 36% AD with every attack, yes. With an attack speed of 3.0.

This means he just deals slightly more damage than 1 AA per second. That by itself really is not impressive.
And I don't get where you got the idea that he can just walk up to a turret and kill it with no minions, tbh. Compared to other juggernauts, he really isn't that tanky actually.

It's a tiny dash and Flash is not an ability lol Every champ can take Flash.
Try learning how his abilities actually work, because he does not have most of these.

he has everything i just said though i did forget to mention his low cooldown passive which gives him free aoe on a large cone in front of him which also hits things outside the indicator. his aoe slow his ease of both farming escaping surviving catching killing executing ccing taking turrets. 

Seriously what is his weakness?

His poke is easily dodged, he has a clear threat range with one only dash, and you can see which of his leg aoes are available.

He is annoying, but any mobile ranged champion shreds him.

30 seconds on his passive at early rank isn't low. 80 mana on his Q isn't cheap to use, so using it purely for farming instead of poking can seriously hamper his lane pressure. His E is a dash that's just as long as Galio's and it has a delay unlike Lucian's or Riven's dash.

Urgot is classified as a juggernaut of sorts... the only ranged one.

like all juggernaut kiting is his many weakness, he also has NO in-build sustain and is forced to abuse conqueror for any healing at all.
get a tank to CC him, then watch your ADC melt him like a Popsicle on a searing hot summer day. 

alternatively gank him from 2 sides, as he can only use his W + passive on 1 person.

ranged champions also dumpster him in lane.

lastly in the early stages he likes to build black cleaver and frozen mallet / death's dance. this leaves him open to %HP dmg so you can shred him that way.

of course playing the ultimate juggernaut counter {{champion:67}} is almost bound to have success
